section.section: A bond and the interest on a bond are limited obligations of the public body.

Except for bond anticipation notes and notes in the nature of commercial paper, the principal of, premium, and interest on a bond are payable solely from:
money from the financing of a facility; or
other money made available to the public body.

Bonds and the interest on them:
are not debts or charges against the general credit or taxing powers of a public body within the meaning of any constitutional or charter provision or statutory limitation; and
may not give rise to any pecuniary liability of an issuing public body.

A bond may state on its face that the bond:
is issued under this subtitle; and
is not a debt to which the public body's faith and credit is pledged.

text.section:
On default in the payment of the principal of or interest on a bond, a court with jurisdiction:
may appoint a receiver or take other appropriate action to provide for the payment of the bond; and
shall apply any available revenue as this subtitle or a resolution adopted under this subtitle provides.
